column2: What concerns would you face when asked to fully disclose LLM involvement?
column11: What personal benefits do you associate with following the AI usage disclosure policy?
column15: What concerns would you face when asked to ensure full human oversight of LLM-generated bug fixes?
column24: What personal benefits do you associate with following the AI usage human oversight policy?

column3: Intellectual property risk and security concerns
column4: Reputational Impact- May raise doubts about code quality or team competence
column5: Loss of control over own work
column6: Fear of judgment about AI reliance
column11: Disclosing AI usage in my code protects me from being unfairly blamed for bugs later.
column12: I believe that documenting AI involvement increases trust in my contributions.
column13: Transparency about AI usage improves team collaboration and communication.
column14: I would be more likely to disclose LLM usage if it meant earning formal credit or recognition.
column15: Added workload due to mandatory manual review
column16: Lack of time or resources to verify every AI-generated change
column17: Limited technical understanding of the AI-generated code
column18: Uncertainty about who is accountable for mistakes
column19: Absence of clear organizational standards for validation
column20: Difficulty coordinating review responsibilities within the team
column21: Over-reliance on automated tools makes manual oversight redundant
column24: I feel more confident deploying code that has gone through human oversight, even if it was AI-assisted.
column25: Human validation of AI-generated fixes helps me learn and improve my own debugging skills.
column26: If oversight is enforced, I feel less personally responsible for future issues in the code.
column27: I would get recognition for responsible coding.

column10: Whenever using any kind of AI, the organization should always know and developers should always follow organization rules. In that case, no concerns.     Developers should not even upload one line of coad or any info to AI if it is not permitted by the org. If one does that and have to disclose that to the org later, pretty much all of the above will be concerning.
column23: Shouldn't the concerns will be more if there is NO human oversight? AI generated code should never be commited without human oversight. It will definitely create problems, and will be more time consuming and expensive in the long run. And the person who is writting/commiting the code is always responsible. No matter if they use AI or not.
